cleaned_text: Running Head: Assignment 12 Vaccines and Autism Some parents do not vaccinate their children against measles, mumps, and rubella. This is because Andrew Wakefield published, what is now viewed as fraudulent research, a paper detailing the correlation between onset of autism in children and the MMR vaccine. This resulted in an increase in the number of deaths of children from these diseases. The scientific process always begins by asking a question and there is no such thing as a question too absurd to be investigated. There are few hypotheses that could have been reached through conducting some background research on the correlation of the MMR vaccine and onset of autism.
